intro: Diacles, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, often yellow or white flowers. The plant is shrub-like, with compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Diacles species are known for their ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Some species have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties.
